name: Violeta Parra
description:
'''Violeta del Carmen Parra Sandoval''' ({{IPA|es|bjoˈleta ˈpara}}; 4 October 1917 – 5 February 1967) was a Chilean composer, singer-songwriter, [[folklore|folklorist]], [[Ethnomusicology|ethnomusicologist]] and visual artist. She pioneered the [[Nueva Canción Chilena]] (The Chilean New Song), a renewal and a reinvention of Chilean [[folk music]] that would extend its sphere of influence outside Chile.

Her birthdate (4 October) was chosen as "Chilean Musicians' Day." In 2011, [[Andrés Wood]] directed a biopic about her, titled ''[[Violeta Went to Heaven]]'' (Spanish: ''Violeta se fue a los cielos'').
